content: I would be grateful if we could move forward with this PR, which has been open for several weeks now. I have quite a lot of code queued up behind it (starting with #21079 – the open-covers PR was my response to a reviewer suggestion on that PR).
(see discussion here: #mathlib4 > Definition of a covering of a topological space? )

I don't want to keep up this PR, but I'm wondering if it would make sense to have a predicate IsCover for a family S : I -> Foo where Foo is a SetLike type, such as Opens X or Clopens X (but potentially also Subgroup X).

And then IsOpenCover could extend that. But the result about refining an open cover of a profinite set by a clopen cover could make use of the readable IsCover terminology.

Hi Johan,

I also wondered about defining covers by an arbitrary SetLike type. However, the problem is that to make this usable, we need to have typeclasses that encode not only the existence of lattice structures (iSup and \top) on a SetLike type, but also compatibility of these structures with the usual ones on sets.

This was precisely the motivation for the LawfulTop, etc, typeclasses that I suggested in a zulip discussion last month (#mathlib4 > proposal: lattice operations on `SetLike`s? ), but nobody seemed keen on the proposal – as was pointed out there, most SetLike types in mathlib are things like subgroups, subrings, etc for which the natural supremum operation is not set-wise union (and the bottom element is not the empty set) – the Opens, Closeds, and Clopens types for a topological space seem to be the only examples in mathlib of set-likes preserved under all the lattice operations.
Ok, let's just try this out in practice. I've bors d+d the open covers PR
